top_quote: They really hate it being public actionable knowledge that BBBY (Overstock) is merging with BBBYQ (bankrupt) as proven by the CUSIP-6 unique identifier. ... What is CUSIP? It's how the stock market manages settlement on the back end. Each stock has a 6 digit unique identifier called a CUSIP-6 and then each instrument for that stock (shares, bonds, warrants, etc) has a few numbers and a check digit at the end of the CUSIP-6. The warrants for BBBY (Overstock) were issued with the CUSIP-6 for BBBYQ (bankrupt).

This isn't hypothetical, this doesn't violate any laws. Banks can simply say "you didn't prove you DIDN'T come from XMR, therefore your account is closed". Watch it happen. And you've had no workaround.
---
The workaround to this is to call an attorney.
---

subject: Have you ever made investment decisions on LSD?
